Jul 28, 2021 | 08:10 AM EDT DOUG KASS Shorting Apple After reviewing last night's Apple ($AAPL) quarterly release, I have taken a trading short rental in premarket trading (with an objective into the low- to mid- $130s). My rationale: * A high valuation relative to history.

* Difficult compares may lie ahead, especially in the iPhone. * Possible sourcing issues in 2021-2. * With an all-time high share price, the marginal impact (return on capital) of the company's aggressive capital allocation strategy (company buybacks) has been diminished.

* Over owned and heavily weighted in all Indices, Apple could be seen as an ATM in a market correction. I would note that my record shorting Apple has been sub optimal. @SquawkCNBC @tomkeene @jimcramer @carlquintanilla @riskreversal @ScottWapnerCNBC @threadreaderapp unroll
